altVulnerabilityRed: Prismatic Weakness (Replaces Vulnerability to ${"Vulnerability"} Damage). If ${"the dragon / name"} takes ${"Alt Vulnerability Scaling Value"} or more ${"vulnerability lower"} damage between the start of ${"its/her"} turn and the start of ${"its/her"} next turn, ${"the dragon / name"} temporarily loses the following features: ${"Alt Vulnerability Features Lost"}. After 10 minutes, the features are restored, and this weakness cannot be triggered again for 1 hour.
altVulnerabilityOrange: Prismatic Weakness (Replaces Vulnerability to ${"Vulnerability"} Damage). If ${"the dragon / name"} starts ${"its/her"} turn in a strong wind (21 or more miles per hour), roll a d20. If the result is ${"Alt Vulnerability Scaling Value"} or lower, ${"the dragon / name"} temporarily loses the following features: ${"Alt Vulnerability Features Lost"}. After 10 minutes, the features are restored, and this weakness cannot be triggered again for 1 hour.
altVulnerabilityYellow: Prismatic Weakness (Replaces Vulnerability to ${"Vulnerability"} Damage). If ${"the dragon / name"} takes ${"Alt Vulnerability Scaling Value"} or more ${"vulnerability lower"} damage between the start of ${"its/her"} turn and the start of ${"its/her"} next turn, ${"the dragon / name"} temporarily loses the following features: ${"Alt Vulnerability Features Lost"}. After 10 minutes, the features are restored, and this weakness cannot be triggered again for 1 hour.
altVulnerabilityGreen: Prismatic Weakness (Replaces Vulnerability to ${"Vulnerability"} Damage). If ${"the dragon / name"} is the target of a [spell]passwall[/spell] spell or another spell of equal or greater level that can open a portal on a solid surface, the spell's normal effects do not happen. Instead, the spellcaster must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} ability check using its spellcasting ability, adding the level of the spell to its roll. On a success, ${"the dragon / name"} temporarily loses the following features: ${"Alt Vulnerability Features Lost"}. After 10 minutes, the features are restored, and this weakness cannot be triggered again for 1 hour.
altVulnerabilityBlue: Prismatic Weakness (Replaces Vulnerability to ${"Vulnerability"} Damage). If ${"the dragon / name"} takes ${"Alt Vulnerability Scaling Value"} or more ${"vulnerability lower"} damage between the start of ${"its/her"} turn and the start of ${"its/her"} next turn, ${"the dragon / name"} temporarily loses the following features: ${"Alt Vulnerability Features Lost"}. After 10 minutes, the features are restored, and this weakness cannot be triggered again for 1 hour.
altVulnerabilityIndigo: Prismatic Weakness (Replaces Vulnerability to ${"Vulnerability"} Damage). If ${"the dragon / name"} starts ${"its/her"} turn in bright light shed by a [spell]daylight[/spell] spell or a similar spell of equal or higher level, roll a d20, subtracting the level of the highest-leveled spell shedding such light. If the result is ${"Alt Vulnerability Scaling Value"} or lower, ${"the dragon / name"} temporarily loses the following features: ${"Alt Vulnerability Features Lost"}. After 10 minutes, the features are restored, and this weakness cannot be triggered again for 1 hour.
altVulnerabilityViolet: Prismatic Weakness (Replaces Vulnerability to ${"Vulnerability"} Damage). If ${"the dragon / name"} is the target of a [spell]dispel magic[/spell] spell or a similar spell of equal or higher level that can end spells and magical effects, the spell's effects happen as normal. In addition, the spellcaster must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} ability check using its spellcasting ability, adding the level of the spell to its roll. On a success, ${"the dragon / name"} temporarily loses the following features: ${"Alt Vulnerability Features Lost"}. After 10 minutes, the features are restored, and this weakness cannot be triggered again for 1 hour.
altVulnerabilityMagenta: Prismatic Weakness (Replaces Vulnerability to ${"Vulnerability"} Damage). If ${"the dragon / name"} takes ${"Alt Vulnerability Scaling Value"} or more ${"vulnerability lower"} damage between the start of ${"its/her"} turn and the start of ${"its/her"} next turn, ${"the dragon / name"} temporarily loses the following features: ${"Alt Vulnerability Features Lost"}. After 10 minutes, the features are restored, and this weakness cannot be triggered again for 1 hour.
altVulnerabilityWhite: Prismatic Weakness (Replaces Vulnerability to ${"Vulnerability"} Damage). If ${"the dragon / name"} takes ${"Alt Vulnerability Scaling Value"} or more ${"vulnerability lower"} damage between the start of ${"its/her"} turn and the start of ${"its/her"} next turn, ${"the dragon / name"} temporarily loses the following features: ${"Alt Vulnerability Features Lost"}. After 10 minutes, the features are restored, and this weakness cannot be triggered again for 1 hour.
altVulnerabilityBlack: Prismatic Weakness (Replaces Vulnerability to ${"Vulnerability"} Damage). If ${"the dragon / name"} starts ${"its/her"} turn in bright light shed by a [spell]daylight[/spell] spell or a similar spell of equal or higher level, roll a d20, subtracting the level of the highest-leveled spell shedding such light. If the result is ${"Alt Vulnerability Scaling Value"} or lower, ${"the dragon / name"} temporarily loses the following features: ${"Alt Vulnerability Features Lost"}. After 10 minutes, the features are restored, and this weakness cannot be triggered again for 1 hour.
sidebarDescription:
OPTIONAL ${"Color CAPS"} ${"Age CAPS"} FEATURES

The following features can be added to customize ${"the dragon / name"}'s stat block. None of these features affect ${"the dragon / name"}'s challenge rating.
sidebarDescriptionSingular:
OPTIONAL ${"Color CAPS"} ${"Age CAPS"} FEATURE

The following feature can be added to customize ${"the dragon / name"}'s stat block. This feature doesn't affect ${"the dragon / name"}'s challenge rating.
amphibious: Amphibious. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} can breathe air and water.
innateSpellcastingDescriptionAdult: Innate Spellcasting. ${"The dragon / Name upper"}'s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma${"Spells DC String"}. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} can innately cast the following spell${"Spell or Spells"}, requiring no material components:
sidebarInnateSpellcastingDescription: Innate Spellcasting. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} has the following spells${"Diff Spells DC String"} added to ${"its/her"} Innate Spellcasting feature:
legendaryResistance: Legendary Resistance (${"Legendary Resistances"}/Day). If ${"the dragon / name"} fails a saving throw, ${"it/she"} can choose to succeed instead.
magicResistance: Magic Resistance. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
magicWeapons: Magic Weapons. ${"The dragon / Name upper"}’s weapon attacks are magical.
prismaticAwakening: Prismatic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). If ${"the dragon / name"} would be reduced to 0 hit points, ${"its/her"} current hit point total instead resets to 450 hit points, ${"it/she"} recharges ${"its/her"} Breath Weapon, and ${"it/she"} regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, ${"the dragon / name"} can now use the options in the “Mythic Actions” section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional ${"XP"} XP (${"Double XP"} XP total) for defeating ${"the dragon / name"} after ${"its/her"} Prismatic Awakening activates.
unusualNature: Unusual Nature. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} doesn't require food or drink.
multiattackYoung: Multiattack. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} makes three attacks: one with ${"its/her"} bite and two with ${"its/her"} claws.
multiattackAdult: Multiattack. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} can use ${"its/her"} Frightful Presence. ${"it/she upper"} then makes three attacks: one with ${"its/her"} bite and two with ${"its/her"} claws.
bite: Bite. Melee Weapon Attack: ${"Proficiency + STR with sign"} to hit, reach ${"Bite Reach"} ft., one target. Hit: ${"Bite Expected Damage"} (${"Bite Dice Count"}d${"Bite Dice Type"} ${"STR sign"} ${"abs STR"}) piercing damage plus ${"Bite Element Expected Damage"} (${"Bite Element Dice Count"}d${"Bite Element Dice Type"}) ${"Immunity Lower"} damage.
biteNoElement: Bite. Melee Weapon Attack: ${"Proficiency + STR with sign"} to hit, reach ${"Bite Reach"} ft., one target. Hit: ${"Bite Expected Damage"} (${"Bite Dice Count"}d${"Bite Dice Type"} ${"STR sign"} ${"abs STR"}) piercing damage.
claw: Claw. Melee Weapon Attack: ${"Proficiency + STR with sign"} to hit, reach ${"Claw Reach"} ft., one target. Hit: ${"Claw Expected Damage"} (${"Claw Dice Count"}d${"Claw Dice Type"} ${"STR sign"} ${"abs STR"}) slashing damage.${"Claw Rider"}
clawRiderForGreatwyrm: If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is [condition]grappled[/condition] (escape DC ${"STR Plus Ten"}) and is [condition]restrained[/condition] until this grapple ends. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} can have only one creature [condition]grappled[/condition] in this way at a time.
tail: Tail. Melee Weapon Attack: ${"Proficiency + STR with sign"} to hit, reach ${"Tail Reach"} ft., one target. Hit: ${"Tail Expected Damage"} (${"Tail Dice Count"}d${"Tail Dice Type"} ${"STR sign"} ${"abs STR"}) bludgeoning damage.${"Tail Rider"}
tailRiderForGreatwyrm: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC ${"Save DC STR"} Strength saving throw or be knocked [condition]prone[/condition].
frightfulPresence: Frightful Presence. Each creature of ${"the dragon / name"}'s choice that is within 120 feet of ${"the dragon / name"} and aware of ${"it/her"} must succeed on a DC ${"Save DC CHA"} Wisdom saving throw or become [condition]frightened[/condition] for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to ${"the dragon / name"}'s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.
sidebarBreathPrefix: Breath Weapons. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} has two breath weapon options: ${"Breath 1 Name"} Breath and ${"Breath 2 Name"} Breath. Both share the same Recharge 5–6 usage.
breathRedWyrmling: Fire Breath (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} exhales fire in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Dexterity saving throw, taking ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
breathRed1:
Breath Weapons (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} uses one of the following breath weapons.

Fire Breath. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} exhales fire in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Dexterity saving throw, taking ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
breathRed2: Captivating Breath. Red rays of magical light flash from ${"the dragon / name"}'s mouth in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is [condition]charmed[/condition] by ${"the dragon / name"}${"Breath 2 Special Value"} until ${"the dragon / name"} harms it. As a bonus action, ${"the dragon / name"} can end the effect early for all affected creatures within 300 feet of ${"the dragon / name"}.
breathOrangeWyrmling: Acid Breath (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} exhales acid in a ${"Breath Line Length"}-foot line that is ${"Breath Line Width"} feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Dexterity saving throw, taking ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
breathOrange1:
Breath Weapons (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} uses one of the following breath weapons.

Acid Breath. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} exhales acid in a ${"Breath Line Length"}-foot line that is ${"Breath Line Width"} feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Dexterity saving throw, taking ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
breathOrange2: Smothering Breath. Orange rays of magical light flash from ${"the dragon / name"}'s mouth in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is [condition]restrained[/condition] for 1 minute. While [condition]restrained[/condition] in this way, it can’t speak or cast spells which include a verbal component. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success.
breathYellowWyrmling: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} exhales lightning in a ${"Breath Line Length"}-foot line that is ${"Breath Line Width"} feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) lightning damage and is [condition]paralyzed[/condition] until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't [condition]paralyzed[/condition].
breathYellow1:
Breath Weapons (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} uses one of the following breath weapons.

Lightning Breath. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} exhales lightning in a ${"Breath Line Length"}-foot line that is ${"Breath Line Width"} feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) lightning damage and is [condition]paralyzed[/condition] until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't [condition]paralyzed[/condition].
breathYellow2: Revelation Breath. Yellow rays of magical light flash from ${"the dragon / name"}'s mouth in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, divination magic connects the creature and ${"the dragon / name"} for 1 minute. While connected, ${"the dragon / name"} is [condition]invisible[/condition] to the creature, and ${"the dragon / name"} knows the creature’s location while they are on the same plane of existence. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success. As a bonus action, ${"the dragon / name"} can end the effect early for one or more affected creatures, learning the following about each: its name (if any), its creature type, and something that looms large in its mind (such as something it worries over, loves, or hates).
breathGreenWyrmling: Poison Breath (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} exhales poisonous gas in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) poison damage and is [condition]poisoned[/condition] until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't [condition]poisoned[/condition].
breathGreen1:
Breath Weapons (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} uses one of the following breath weapons.

Poison Breath. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} exhales poisonous gas in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) poison damage and is [condition]poisoned[/condition] until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't [condition]poisoned[/condition].
breathGreen2: Sleep Breath. Green rays of magical light flash from ${"the dragon / name"}'s mouth in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Wisdom saving throw or fall [condition]unconscious[/condition] ${"Breath 2 Special Value"}. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature uses an action to shake it awake.
breathBlueWyrmling: Cold Breath (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} exhales an icy blast in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) cold damage and has its speed halved until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn’t have its speed halved.
breathBlue1:
Breath Weapons (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} uses one of the following breath weapons.

Cold Breath. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} exhales an icy blast in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) cold damage and has its speed halved until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn’t have its speed halved.
breathBlue2:
Wild Magic Breath. Blue rays of magical light flash from ${"the dragon / name"}'s mouth in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is subject to ${"Breath 2 Special Value"}.

1. Floating Feeling. The creature levitates (as if affected by the [spell]levitate[/spell] spell), and its flying speed (if any) becomes 0.

2. Blue Glow. The creature is outlined in blue light, shedding dim light in a 10-foot radius. Any attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the creature can't benefit from being [condition]invisible[/condition].

3. Violent Hiccups. The creature violently hiccups. It has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration.

4. Froggy Jinx. The creature is transformed into a [monster]frog[/monster], as if by the [spell]polymorph[/spell] spell.
breathIndigoWyrmling: Thunder Breath (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} unleashes a deafening boom in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) thunder damage and is [condition]deafened[/condition] until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn’t [condition]deafened[/condition]. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw and is shattered if reduced to 0 hit points by this damage.
breathIndigo1:
Breath Weapons (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} uses one of the following breath weapons.

Thunder Breath. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} unleashes a deafening boom in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) thunder damage and is [condition]deafened[/condition] until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn’t [condition]deafened[/condition]. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw and is shattered if reduced to 0 hit points by this damage.
breathIndigo2: Petrifying Breath. Indigo rays of magical light flash from ${"the dragon / name"}'s mouth in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is [condition]restrained[/condition] until the end of its next turn, at which time it must repeat the saving throw. If it fails this second save as well, the creature turns to stone and is [condition]petrified[/condition] ${"Breath 2 Special Value"}until freed by the [spell]greater restoration[/spell] spell or other magic.
breathVioletWyrmling: Force Breath (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} exhales condensed magical energy in a ${"Breath Line Length"}-foot line that is ${"Breath Line Width"} feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Dexterity saving throw, taking ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature which is at 0 hit points after taking this damage must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Constitution saving throw. If it fails this save, the creature and all nonmagical objects it is wearing or carrying are disintegrated, reduced to a pile of fine violet dust.
breathViolet1:
Breath Weapons (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} uses one of the following breath weapons.

Force Breath. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} exhales condensed magical energy in a ${"Breath Line Length"}-foot line that is ${"Breath Line Width"} feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Dexterity saving throw, taking ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature which is at 0 hit points after taking this damage must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Constitution saving throw. If it fails this save, the creature and all nonmagical objects it is wearing or carrying are disintegrated, reduced to a pile of fine violet dust.
breathViolet2: Banishing Breath. Violet rays of magical light flash from ${"the dragon / name"}'s mouth in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is [condition]blinded[/condition] until the end of its next turn, at which time it must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Charisma saving throw. If it fails this second save as well, the creature is banished to another plane of the ${"DM/GM"}’s choosing. Typically, a creature that is on a plane that isn’t its home plane is banished home, while other creatures are usually cast into the Astral or Ethereal planes.
breathViolet2EndYoung: After ${"Breath 2 Special Value"}, if the creature is still on that plane, it reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
breathViolet2EndAdult: As a bonus action, ${"the dragon / name"} can unbanish all the creatures ${"it/she"} has banished within the last hour. When a creature is unbanished, it reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. This fails for any creature that is no longer on the plane it was banished to.
breathMagentaWyrmling: Psychic Breath (Recharge 5–6). Psychic static surges from ${"the dragon / name"}’s mouth in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) psychic damage and is [condition]stunned[/condition] until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't [condition]stunned[/condition].
breathMagenta1:
Breath Weapons (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} uses one of the following breath weapons.

Psychic Breath. Psychic static surges from ${"the dragon / name"}’s mouth in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) psychic damage and is [condition]stunned[/condition] until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't [condition]stunned[/condition].
breathMagenta2: Amnesia Breath. Magenta rays of magical light flash from ${"the dragon / name"}’s mouth in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is [condition]charmed[/condition] by ${"the dragon / name"} until the end of ${"the dragon / name"}'s next turn, at which time the creature must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Intelligence saving throw. If it fails this second save as well, the creature forgets everything it sensed, experienced, and learned during the past ${"Breath 2 Special Value"}.
breathWhiteWyrmling: Radiant Breath (Recharge 5–6). Dazzling, multi-colored light flashes from ${"the dragon / name"}'s mouth in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) radiant damage and is [condition]blinded[/condition] until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't [condition]blinded[/condition].
breathWhite1:
Breath Weapons (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} uses one of the following breath weapons.

Radiant Breath. Dazzling, multi-colored light flashes from ${"the dragon / name"}'s mouth in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) radiant damage and is [condition]blinded[/condition] until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't [condition]blinded[/condition].
breathWhite2: Fatigue Breath. White rays of magical light flash from ${"the dragon / name"}'s mouth in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area has its speed doubled until the end of its next turn, at which time it must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains 2 (1d4) levels of [condition]exhaustion[/condition]. If a creature would be brought to 6 levels of [condition]exhaustion[/condition] by this breath weapon, it is instead brought to 5 levels of [condition]exhaustion[/condition] and knocked [condition]prone[/condition].
breathBlackWyrmling: Necrotic Breath (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} exhales negative energy in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) necrotic damage and can't regain hit points until the start of ${"the dragon / name"}'s next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't prevented from regaining hit points.
breathBlack1:
Breath Weapons (Recharge 5–6). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} uses one of the following breath weapons.

Necrotic Breath. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} exhales negative energy in a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ${"Save DC CON"} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes ${"Breath 1 Expected Damage"} (${"Breath 1 Dice Count"}d${"Breath 1 Dice Type"}) necrotic damage and can't regain hit points until the start of ${"the dragon / name"}'s next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't prevented from regaining hit points.
breathBlack2: Immortality Breath. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} exhales magical darkness which briefly fills a ${"Breath Cone Size"}-foot cone. Each creature in that area gains ${"Breath 2 Special Value"}, manifesting as a shroud of shadow. While the creature has these hit points, the creature has advantage on all saving throws and doesn't age.
prismaticRadiance: Variable Radiance. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} chooses a radius up to ${"Prismatic Radiance Radius"} feet and glows ${"Color Lower"}, shedding bright light in the chosen radius and dim light for an additional distance equal to the chosen radius. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} stops glowing if ${"it/she"} dies or chooses to stop as a bonus action.
diminishLight: Variable Shadow. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} chooses a radius up to ${"Prismatic Radiance Radius"} feet, dimming light within the chosen radius: bright light becomes dim light and dim light becomes darkness. Light is not dimmed if it is shed by a [spell]daylight[/spell] spell or a similar spell of equal or higher level. This effect ends if ${"the dragon / name"} dies or chooses to stop as a bonus action.
wallOfPrismaticColorNew:
Wall of Prismatic ${"Color Upper"} (1/Day). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} casts [spell]prismatic wall[/spell] (spell save DC ${"Save DC CHA"}), but the wall just has its ${"Wall Layers"}. The wall's bright and dim light each have a range of 60 feet instead of 100 feet, and its light isn't blinding.

If ${"the dragon / name"} casts this spell with a casting time of 10 minutes instead of 1 action, the wall remains in place until it's destroyed or ${"the dragon / name"} uses this feature again.
changeShape:
Change Shape. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} magically transforms into a Humanoid or Beast, or back into ${"its/her"} true form. Any objects ${"it/she"} is wearing or carrying are absorbed or borne by the new form (${"the dragon / name"}'s choice). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} reverts to ${"its/her"} true form if ${"it/she"} is reduced to 0 hit points.

In the new form, ${"the dragon / name"} retains ${"its/her"} personality, hit points, mental ability scores, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, and Variable Radiance, as well as this feature. ${"its/her upper"} statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.
legendaryDescription: ${"The dragon / Name upper"} can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} regains spent legendary actions at the start of ${"its/her"} turn.
legendaryDetect: Detect. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} makes a Wisdom ([skill]Perception[/skill]) check.
legendaryTailAttack: Tail Attack. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} makes a Tail attack.
legendaryGreatwyrmAttack: Attack. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} makes one Claw or Tail attack.
legendaryWingAttack: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} beats ${"its/her"} wings. Each creature within ${"Wing Attack Radius"} feet of ${"the dragon / name"} must succeed on a DC ${"Save DC STR"} Dexterity saving throw or take ${"Wing Attack Expected Damage"} (2d6 + ${"STR"}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked [condition]prone[/condition]. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} can then fly up to half ${"its/her"} flying speed.
mythicDescription: If ${"the dragon / name"}'s Prismatic Awakening trait has activated in the last hour, ${"it/she"} can use the options below as legendary actions.
mythicBite: Bite. ${"The dragon / Name upper"} makes one Bite attack.
mythicNova: Nova (Costs 3 Actions). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} goes nova. This does a lot of damage.
mythicNovaBlack: Nova (Costs 3 Actions). ${"The dragon / Name upper"} goes nova. This does a lot of damage. Adjusted to be more appropriate for black dragons which don't really go nova.
